channel-type.label: Stop
channel-type.description:
Stop playback control.

Send ON to stop playback. This ends playback and may reset the playback position depending on the client.

Note: Use the media-control channel for play, pause, next, previous, fast-forward, and rewind commands.

channel-type.label: Shuffle
channel-type.description:
Toggle shuffle mode for the playback queue.

ON: Items in the queue will play in random order.
OFF: Items in the queue will play in sequential order.

channel-type.label: Repeat Mode
channel-type.description:
Set the repeat mode for playback.

  • off: Play queue once and stop
  • one: Repeat current item continuously
  • all: Repeat entire queue continuously

channel-type.label: Streaming Quality
channel-type.description:
Set the maximum streaming bitrate to control video quality.

Higher bitrates provide better quality but require more bandwidth:

  • 140000 (140 Kbps): Low quality, minimal bandwidth
  • 500000 (500 Kbps): Medium quality, suitable for mobile
  • 1500000 (1.5 Mbps): High quality, SD streaming
  • 3000000 (3 Mbps): Very high quality, HD streaming
  • 8000000 (8 Mbps): Ultra quality, Full HD streaming

channel-type.label: Audio Track
channel-type.description:
Select the audio track for the current media item.

Use the zero-based stream index to switch between available audio tracks (e.g., different languages or audio formats).

Example: 0 for first track, 1 for second track, etc.

channel-type.label: Subtitle
channel-type.description:
Select or disable the subtitle track for the current media item.

Use the stream index to switch between available subtitle tracks:

  • -1: Disable subtitles
  • 0: First subtitle track
  • 1: Second subtitle track
  • etc.
